page.title: 17SETTLEMENT
page.content: St. Blazey is a town of council owned houses, leased to the people who cannot purchase their own home. Some houses have been bought by the inhabitants, and look better than the rest, whih are a little dirty, due to the couclil being the only people to redecorate them. The majority of land cover is farmland,and very small communities called hamlets. In the Par area, the land is very low, maybe only a few metres above sea-level,but near to St. Blazey, the land rises and in fact the town is on a gentle hill. In the North and West the land is very hilly, but is flatter to the South and East.
